string-array.name: department_array
string-array.item: Center of Life and Food Sciences Weihenstephan

resources.string: TUMitfahrer is my IDP, for which I’m responsible for the Android application. I’m the resident Android evangelist and the go-to guy for everything Android. I particularly like this project as it affords me the opportunity to exercise my skills and experiment with application building techniques.
It’s not a Bug, It’s a feature *evil smile*
TUMitfahrer is an exciting project. I learned a lot of stuff and had a lot of fun. I was on the Android team and I really enjoyed working on the project.
When in danger, when in doubt, run in circles, scream, and shout.
I took this project as IDP. I learned new things like how to use websockets for chat and how to develop responsive web application.
Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
TUMitfahrer was for me the final project for my Master Thesis. I developed complete iOS application and backend using Ruby on Rails. My research included innovative product development processes.
After this project, I like Ruby more than Natalie Portman
TUMitfahrer was an awesome project that gave me the chance to work on multiple platforms. I learnt ROR, Android, iPhone, Java and C++ in a single project.
Whaa! you didn’t get notification??? Probably thunder in the cloud!

Getting an opportunity to work on a real time project with collaborative environment and multiple technologies, couldn’t get anything better. I took it as an IDP and really enjoyed working on Pebble and RoR.
I took this project as my IDP and it is an awesome experience and opportunity to learn new language like Ruby on Rails.
Failure is not an option, it comes bundled with the software.
I took this project as IDP. I learned new things like how to use websockets for chat and how to develop responsive web application.
Test is a procedure of making everything ruined and starting beauty

I took this project as my IDP. In this awesome project, I take charge of all the tests including unit test, ui automatic test, integration test, etc. It is both excited and painful to join all the different platforms with different environments, different programme languages.
Creativity is doing something out of nothing
I took this project as my IDP. Personally i enjoyed that project because i could use my slightly artistic background in real application, to design something which students could enjoy.
Need a ride to the university?
Search for a ride to your campus and join fellow students going to the uni by car. Travel in a nice student atmosphere.
Join activity rides and enjoy cool trip to IKEA, nearby lake or a hiking trip in the mountains.
Have free seats in your car?
Create a ride and share travel expenses between all people.
Request a ride offer. Fellow students will pick you up. Enjoy the car ride.
No valid Google Play Services APK found.
We would love to hear what you have to say…
